summary: Before physicians practice medicine independently, they receive on-the-job training as residents in teaching hospitals. These residents are vital providers of health care during their training, and many stay in the geographic area to practice after their training is completed. Medicare pays these hospitals to offset some of the costs of training physician residents. For most hospitals, Medicare caps the number of residents it will fund...
title: Physician Workforce: Caps on Medicare-Funded Graduate Medical Education at Teaching Hospitals
